title: The Last Bite
premise: A disgraced food critic, now a ghostwriter for celebrity chefs, discovers a chilling pattern: each victim of a recent string of murders was killed after publishing a scathing review of the same, elusive underground supper club. To uncover the killer, she must infiltrate the club's exclusive, deadly tasting menu, where each course is a clue and a potential crime scene.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a former Pulitzer-nominated critic with a hyper-developed palate and a deep-seated fear of failure, who uses her knowledge of food and the cutthroat culinary world as her primary investigative tools.
conflict: Elara must solve the murders and expose the killer before she becomes the next target on the menu, all while battling her own demons and the killer's taunting, food-themed riddles left at each crime scene.
setting: Present-day, in the high-stakes, glamorous yet gritty culinary underworld of a major city like New York or Chicago, moving from Michelin-starred kitchens to hidden, illicit dining rooms.
tone: Darkly suspenseful and atmospheric, with a gourmet's sensual detail contrasted against visceral horror; think 'Hannibal' meets 'The Menu' with a classic whodunnit structure.
